trans-unit.source: Vehicle telemetry analytics solution playbook: deep dive into the solution | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Vehicle telemetry analytics solution playbook: deep dive into the solution | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Use the capabilities of Cortana Analytics to gain real-time and predictive insights on vehicle health and driving habits.
trans-unit.target: Use the capabilities of Cortana Analytics to gain real-time and predictive insights on vehicle health and driving habits.

trans-unit.source: Vehicle telemetry analytics solution playbook: deep dive into the solution
trans-unit.target: Vehicle telemetry analytics solution playbook: deep dive into the solution

trans-unit.source: This **menu** links to the sections of this playbook:
trans-unit.target: This **menu** links to the sections of this playbook:

trans-unit.source: This section drills down into the details of each one of the stages depicted in the Solution Architecture with instructions and pointers for customization.
trans-unit.target: This section drills down into the details of each one of the stages depicted in the Solution Architecture with instructions and pointers for customization.

trans-unit.source: Data Sources
trans-unit.target: Data Sources

trans-unit.source: The solution uses two different data sources:
trans-unit.target: The solution uses two different data sources:

trans-unit.source: **simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset** and
trans-unit.target: **simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset** and

trans-unit.source: **vehicle catalog**
trans-unit.target: **vehicle catalog**

trans-unit.source: A vehicle telematics simulator is included as part of this solution.
trans-unit.target: A vehicle telematics simulator is included as part of this solution.

trans-unit.source: It emits diagnostic information and signals corresponding to the state of the vehicle and driving pattern at a given point in time.
trans-unit.target: It emits diagnostic information and signals corresponding to the state of the vehicle and driving pattern at a given point in time.

trans-unit.source: Click [Vehicle Telematics Simulator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717075) to download the **Vehicle Telematics Simulator Visual Studio Solution** for customizations based on your requirements.
trans-unit.target: Click [Vehicle Telematics Simulator](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717075) to download the **Vehicle Telematics Simulator Visual Studio Solution** for customizations based on your requirements.

trans-unit.source: The vehicle catalog contains a reference dataset with a VIN to model mapping.
trans-unit.target: The vehicle catalog contains a reference dataset with a VIN to model mapping.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 2 – Vehicle Telematics Simulator*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 2 – Vehicle Telematics Simulator*

trans-unit.source: This is a JSON format dataset and contains the below schema.
trans-unit.target: This is a JSON format dataset and contains the below schema.

trans-unit.source: Column
trans-unit.target: Column

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Values
trans-unit.target: Values

trans-unit.source: VIN
trans-unit.target: VIN

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated Vehicle Identification Number
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated Vehicle Identification Number

trans-unit.source: This is obtained from a master list of 10,000 randomly generated vehicle identification number
trans-unit.target: This is obtained from a master list of 10,000 randomly generated vehicle identification number

trans-unit.source: Outside temperature
trans-unit.target: Outside temperature

trans-unit.source: The outside temperature where the vehicle is driving
trans-unit.target: The outside temperature where the vehicle is driving

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-100
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-100

trans-unit.source: Engine temperature
trans-unit.target: Engine temperature

trans-unit.source: The engine temperature of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The engine temperature of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-500
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-500

trans-unit.source: Speed
trans-unit.target: Speed

trans-unit.source: The engine speed at which the vehicle is driving
trans-unit.target: The engine speed at which the vehicle is driving

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-100
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-100

trans-unit.source: Fuel
trans-unit.target: Fuel

trans-unit.source: The fuel level of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The fuel level of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates fuel level percentage)
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates fuel level percentage)

trans-unit.source: EngineOil
trans-unit.target: EngineOil

trans-unit.source: The engine oil level of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The engine oil level of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates engine oil level percentage)
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates engine oil level percentage)

trans-unit.source: Tirepressure
trans-unit.target: Tirepressure

trans-unit.source: The tirepressure of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The tirepressure of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-50 (indicates tirepressure level percentage)
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-50 (indicates tirepressure level percentage)

trans-unit.source: Odometer
trans-unit.target: Odometer

trans-unit.source: The odometer reading of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The odometer reading of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-200000
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-200000

trans-unit.source: Accelerator_pedal_position
trans-unit.target: Accelerator_pedal_position

trans-unit.source: The accelerator pedal position of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The accelerator pedal position of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates accelerator level percentage)
trans-unit.target: Randomly generated number from 0-100 (indicates accelerator level percentage)

trans-unit.source: Parking_brake_status
trans-unit.target: Parking_brake_status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the vehicle is parked or not
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the vehicle is parked or not

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: Headlamp_status
trans-unit.target: Headlamp_status

trans-unit.source: Indicates where the headlamp is on or not
trans-unit.target: Indicates where the headlamp is on or not

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: Brake_pedal_status
trans-unit.target: Brake_pedal_status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the brake pedal is pressed or not
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the brake pedal is pressed or not

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: Transmission_gear_position
trans-unit.target: Transmission_gear_position

trans-unit.source: The transmission gear position of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The transmission gear position of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: States: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth
trans-unit.target: States: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth

trans-unit.source: Ignition_status
trans-unit.target: Ignition_status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the vehicle is running or stopped
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the vehicle is running or stopped

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: Windshield_wiper_status
trans-unit.target: Windshield_wiper_status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the windshield wiper is turned or not
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the windshield wiper is turned or not

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: ABS
trans-unit.target: ABS

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether ABS is engaged or not
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether ABS is engaged or not

trans-unit.source: True or False
trans-unit.target: True or False

trans-unit.source: Timestamp
trans-unit.target: Timestamp

trans-unit.source: The timestamp when the data point is created
trans-unit.target: The timestamp when the data point is created

trans-unit.source: Date
trans-unit.target: Date

trans-unit.source: City
trans-unit.target: City

trans-unit.source: The location of the vehicle
trans-unit.target: The location of the vehicle

trans-unit.source: 4 cities in this solution : Bellevue, Redmond, Sammamish, Seattle
trans-unit.target: 4 cities in this solution : Bellevue, Redmond, Sammamish, Seattle

trans-unit.source: To generate simulated data
trans-unit.target: To generate simulated data

trans-unit.source: Click on the arrow on the upper right on the Vehicle Telematics Simulator node in to download the data simulator package.
trans-unit.target: Click on the arrow on the upper right on the Vehicle Telematics Simulator node in to download the data simulator package.

trans-unit.source: Save and extract the files locally on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Save and extract the files locally on your machine.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig3-vehicle-telemetry-blueprint.png) *Figure 3 – Vehicle Telemetry Analytics Solution Blueprint*
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig3-vehicle-telemetry-blueprint.png) *Figure 3 – Vehicle Telemetry Analytics Solution Blueprint*

trans-unit.source: On your local machine, go to the folder where you extracted the Vehicle Telematics Simulator package.
trans-unit.target: On your local machine, go to the folder where you extracted the Vehicle Telematics Simulator package.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig4-vehicle-telematics-simulator-folder.png) *Figure 4 – Vehicle Telematics Simulator folder*
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig4-vehicle-telematics-simulator-folder.png) *Figure 4 – Vehicle Telematics Simulator folder*

trans-unit.source: Execute the application **CarEventGenerator.exe**.
trans-unit.target: Execute the application **CarEventGenerator.exe**.

trans-unit.source: References
trans-unit.target: References

trans-unit.source: [Vehicle Telematics Simulator Visual Studio Solution](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717075)
trans-unit.target: [Vehicle Telematics Simulator Visual Studio Solution](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717075)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Event Hub](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/event-hubs/)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Event Hub](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/event-hubs/)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/data-factory/)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Data Factory](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/learning-paths/data-factory/)

trans-unit.source: Ingestion
trans-unit.target: Ingestion

trans-unit.source: Combinations of Azure Event Hubs, Stream Analytics and Data Factory are leveraged to ingest the vehicle signals and the diagnostic events and real-time and batch analytics.
trans-unit.target: Combinations of Azure Event Hubs, Stream Analytics and Data Factory are leveraged to ingest the vehicle signals and the diagnostic events and real-time and batch analytics.

trans-unit.source: All these components are created and configured as part of the solution deployment.
trans-unit.target: All these components are created and configured as part of the solution deployment.

trans-unit.source: Real-time analysis
trans-unit.target: Real-time analysis

trans-unit.source: The events generated by the Vehicle Telematics Simulator are published to the Event Hub using the Event Hub SDK.
trans-unit.target: The events generated by the Vehicle Telematics Simulator are published to the Event Hub using the Event Hub SDK.

trans-unit.source: The Stream Analytics job ingests these events from the Event Hub and processes the data in real-time to analyze the vehicle health.
trans-unit.target: The Stream Analytics job ingests these events from the Event Hub and processes the data in real-time to analyze the vehicle health.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 5 - Event Hub dashboard*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 5 - Event Hub dashboard*

trans-unit.source: *Figure 6 - Stream analytics job processing data*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 6 - Stream analytics job processing data*

trans-unit.source: The stream analytics job ingests data from the Event Hub, performs a join with the reference data to map the vehicle VIN to the corresponding model and also persists them into Azure blob storage for rich batch analytics.
trans-unit.target: The stream analytics job ingests data from the Event Hub, performs a join with the reference data to map the vehicle VIN to the corresponding model and also persists them into Azure blob storage for rich batch analytics.

trans-unit.source: The below stream analytics query is used to persist the data into Azure blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The below stream analytics query is used to persist the data into Azure blob storage.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 7 - Stream analytics job query for data ingestion*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 7 - Stream analytics job query for data ingestion*

trans-unit.source: Batch analysis
trans-unit.target: Batch analysis

trans-unit.source: We are also generating an additional volume of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset for richer batch analytics.
trans-unit.target: We are also generating an additional volume of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset for richer batch analytics.

trans-unit.source: This is required to ensure a good representative data volume for batch processing.
trans-unit.target: This is required to ensure a good representative data volume for batch processing.

trans-unit.source: For this purpose, we are using a pipeline named ‘PrepareSampleDataPipeline’ in the Azure Data Factory workflow to generate one-year worth of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset.
trans-unit.target: For this purpose, we are using a pipeline named ‘PrepareSampleDataPipeline’ in the Azure Data Factory workflow to generate one-year worth of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset.

trans-unit.source: Click [Data Factory custom activity](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717077) to download the Data Factory custom DotNet activity Visual Studio solution for customizations based on your requirements.
trans-unit.target: Click [Data Factory custom activity](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717077) to download the Data Factory custom DotNet activity Visual Studio solution for customizations based on your requirements.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 8 - Prepare Sample data for batch processing workflow*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 8 - Prepare Sample data for batch processing workflow*

trans-unit.source: The pipeline consists of a custom ADF .Net Activity, show below:
trans-unit.target: The pipeline consists of a custom ADF .Net Activity, show below:

trans-unit.source: *Figure 9 - PrepareSampleDataPipeline*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 9 - PrepareSampleDataPipeline*

trans-unit.source: Once the pipeline executes successfully and ‘RawCarEventsTable’ dataset is marked ‘Ready’, one-year worth of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic data are produced.
trans-unit.target: Once the pipeline executes successfully and ‘RawCarEventsTable’ dataset is marked ‘Ready’, one-year worth of simulated vehicle signals and diagnostic data are produced.

trans-unit.source: You will see the following folder and file created in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container
trans-unit.target: You will see the following folder and file created in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container

trans-unit.source: *Figure 10 - PrepareSampleDataPipeline Output*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 10 - PrepareSampleDataPipeline Output*

trans-unit.source: References
trans-unit.target: References

trans-unit.source: [Azure Event Hub SDK for stream ingestion](event-hubs-csharp-ephcs-getstarted.md)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Event Hub SDK for stream ingestion](event-hubs-csharp-ephcs-getstarted.md)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Data Factory data movement capabilities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) [Azure Data Factory DotNet Activity](data-factory-use-custom-activities.md)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Data Factory data movement capabilities](data-factory-data-movement-activities.md) [Azure Data Factory DotNet Activity](data-factory-use-custom-activities.md)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Data Factory DotNet activity visual studio solution for preparing sample data](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717077)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Data Factory DotNet activity visual studio solution for preparing sample data](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717077)

trans-unit.source: Prepare
trans-unit.target: Prepare

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.ALERT] This step in the solution is applicable only to batch processing.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.ALERT] This step in the solution is applicable only to batch processing.

trans-unit.source: The raw semi-structured vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset is partitioned in the data preparation step into a YEAR/MONTH format for efficient querying and scalable long term storage (i.e. it enables faulting over from one blob account to the next as the first fills up).
trans-unit.target: The raw semi-structured vehicle signals and diagnostic dataset is partitioned in the data preparation step into a YEAR/MONTH format for efficient querying and scalable long term storage (i.e. it enables faulting over from one blob account to the next as the first fills up).

trans-unit.source: The output data (labeled *PartitionedCarEventsTable*) is to be kept for a long period as the foundational/”rawest” form of data in the customer’s “Data Lake”.
trans-unit.target: The output data (labeled *PartitionedCarEventsTable*) is to be kept for a long period as the foundational/”rawest” form of data in the customer’s “Data Lake”.

trans-unit.source: The input data to this pipeline would typically be discarded as the output data has full fidelity to the input - it's just stored (partitioned) better for subsequent use.
trans-unit.target: The input data to this pipeline would typically be discarded as the output data has full fidelity to the input - it's just stored (partitioned) better for subsequent use.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 11 – Partition Car Events workflow*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 11 – Partition Car Events workflow*

trans-unit.source: The raw data is partitioned using a Hive HDInsight activity in ‘PartitionCarEventsPipeline’.
trans-unit.target: The raw data is partitioned using a Hive HDInsight activity in ‘PartitionCarEventsPipeline’.

trans-unit.source: A year worth of sample data generated in step 1 is partitioned by YEAR/MONTH to generate vehicle signals and diagnostic data partitions corresponding to each month (total 12 partitions) in a year.
trans-unit.target: A year worth of sample data generated in step 1 is partitioned by YEAR/MONTH to generate vehicle signals and diagnostic data partitions corresponding to each month (total 12 partitions) in a year.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 12 - PartitionCarEventsPipeline*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 12 - PartitionCarEventsPipeline*

trans-unit.source: The Hive script shown below, named ‘partitioncarevents.hql’, is used for partitioning and is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script shown below, named ‘partitioncarevents.hql’, is used for partitioning and is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 13 - PartitionConnectedCarEvents Hive Script*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 13 - PartitionConnectedCarEvents Hive Script*

trans-unit.source: Once the pipeline is executed successfully, you will see the following partitions generated in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container.
trans-unit.target: Once the pipeline is executed successfully, you will see the following partitions generated in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 14 - Partitioned Output*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 14 - Partitioned Output*

trans-unit.source: The data is now optimized, is more manageable and ready for further processing to gain rich batch insights.
trans-unit.target: The data is now optimized, is more manageable and ready for further processing to gain rich batch insights.

trans-unit.source: Data Analysis
trans-unit.target: Data Analysis

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will see how we have used the combination of Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory and Azure HDInsight for rich advanced analytics on vehicle health and driving habits.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will see how we have used the combination of Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Data Factory and Azure HDInsight for rich advanced analytics on vehicle health and driving habits.

trans-unit.source: There are 3 sub-sections here:
trans-unit.target: There are 3 sub-sections here:

trans-unit.source: **Machine Learning**: This sub-section contains information on the anomaly detection experiment that we have used in this solution to predict vehicles requiring servicing maintenance and vehicles requiring recalls due to safety issues
trans-unit.target: **Machine Learning**: This sub-section contains information on the anomaly detection experiment that we have used in this solution to predict vehicles requiring servicing maintenance and vehicles requiring recalls due to safety issues

trans-unit.source: **Real-time analysis**: This sub-section contains information regarding the real-time analytics using the Stream Analytics Query Language and operationalizing the machine learning experiment in real-time using a custom application
trans-unit.target: **Real-time analysis**: This sub-section contains information regarding the real-time analytics using the Stream Analytics Query Language and operationalizing the machine learning experiment in real-time using a custom application

trans-unit.source: **Batch analysis**: This sub-section contains information regarding the transforming and processing of the batch data using Azure HDInsight and Azure Machine Learning operationalized by Azure Data Factory
trans-unit.target: **Batch analysis**: This sub-section contains information regarding the transforming and processing of the batch data using Azure HDInsight and Azure Machine Learning operationalized by Azure Data Factory

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: Our goal here is to predict the vehicles that require maintenance or recall based on certain heath statistics.
trans-unit.target: Our goal here is to predict the vehicles that require maintenance or recall based on certain heath statistics.

trans-unit.source: We make the following assumptions
trans-unit.target: We make the following assumptions

trans-unit.source: Vehicles require **servicing maintenance** if one of the following three conditions are true:
trans-unit.target: Vehicles require **servicing maintenance** if one of the following three conditions are true:

trans-unit.source: Tire pressure is low
trans-unit.target: Tire pressure is low

trans-unit.source: Engine oil level is low
trans-unit.target: Engine oil level is low

trans-unit.source: Engine temperature is high
trans-unit.target: Engine temperature is high

trans-unit.source: Vehicles may have a **safety issue** and require **recall** if one of the following conditions are true:
trans-unit.target: Vehicles may have a **safety issue** and require **recall** if one of the following conditions are true:

trans-unit.source: Engine temperature is high but outside temperature is low
trans-unit.target: Engine temperature is high but outside temperature is low

trans-unit.source: Engine temperature is low but outside temperature is high
trans-unit.target: Engine temperature is low but outside temperature is high

trans-unit.source: Based on the above requirements, we have created two separate models to detect anomalies, one for vehicle maintenance detection, and one for vehicle recall detection.
trans-unit.target: Based on the above requirements, we have created two separate models to detect anomalies, one for vehicle maintenance detection, and one for vehicle recall detection.

trans-unit.source: In both these models, the built-in Principal Component Analysis (PCA) algorithm is used for anomaly detection .
trans-unit.target: In both these models, the built-in Principal Component Analysis (PCA) algorithm is used for anomaly detection .

trans-unit.source: **Maintenance detection model** In the maintenance detection model, the model reports an anomaly if one of three indicators - tire pressure, engine oil, or engine temperature - satisfies its respective condition.
trans-unit.target: **Maintenance detection model** In the maintenance detection model, the model reports an anomaly if one of three indicators - tire pressure, engine oil, or engine temperature - satisfies its respective condition.

trans-unit.source: As a result, we only need to consider these three variables in building the model.
trans-unit.target: As a result, we only need to consider these three variables in building the model.

trans-unit.source: In our experiment in Azure Machine Learning, we first use a **Project Columns** module to extract these three variables.
trans-unit.target: In our experiment in Azure Machine Learning, we first use a **Project Columns** module to extract these three variables.

trans-unit.source: Next we use the PCA-based anomaly detection module to build the anomaly detection model.
trans-unit.target: Next we use the PCA-based anomaly detection module to build the anomaly detection model.

trans-unit.source: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is an established technique in machine learning that can be applied to feature selection, classification, and anomaly detection.
trans-unit.target: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) is an established technique in machine learning that can be applied to feature selection, classification, and anomaly detection.

trans-unit.source: PCA converts a set of case containing possibly correlated variables, into a set of values called principal components.
trans-unit.target: PCA converts a set of case containing possibly correlated variables, into a set of values called principal components.

trans-unit.source: The key idea of PCA-based modeling is to project data onto a lower-dimensional space so that features and anomalies can be more easily identified.
trans-unit.target: The key idea of PCA-based modeling is to project data onto a lower-dimensional space so that features and anomalies can be more easily identified.

trans-unit.source: In the case of anomaly detection, for each new input, the anomaly detector first computes its projection on the eigenvectors, and then computes the normalized reconstruction error.
trans-unit.target: In the case of anomaly detection, for each new input, the anomaly detector first computes its projection on the eigenvectors, and then computes the normalized reconstruction error.

trans-unit.source: This normalized error is the anomaly score.
trans-unit.target: This normalized error is the anomaly score.

trans-unit.source: The higher the error, the more anomalous the instance is.
trans-unit.target: The higher the error, the more anomalous the instance is.

trans-unit.source: In the maintenance detection problem, each record can be considered as a point in a 3-dimensional space defined by tire pressure, engine oil, and engine temperature coordinates.
trans-unit.target: In the maintenance detection problem, each record can be considered as a point in a 3-dimensional space defined by tire pressure, engine oil, and engine temperature coordinates.

trans-unit.source: To capture these anomalies, we can project the original data in the 3-dimensional onto a 2-dimensional space using PCA.
trans-unit.target: To capture these anomalies, we can project the original data in the 3-dimensional onto a 2-dimensional space using PCA.

trans-unit.source: Thus, we set the parameter Number of components to use in PCA to be 2.
trans-unit.target: Thus, we set the parameter Number of components to use in PCA to be 2.

trans-unit.source: This parameter plays an important role in applying PCA-based anomaly detection.
trans-unit.target: This parameter plays an important role in applying PCA-based anomaly detection.

trans-unit.source: After projecting data using PCA, we can identify these anomalies more easily.
trans-unit.target: After projecting data using PCA, we can identify these anomalies more easily.

trans-unit.source: **Recall anomaly detection model** In the recall anomaly detection model, we use the Project Columns and PCA-based anomaly detection modules in a similar way.
trans-unit.target: **Recall anomaly detection model** In the recall anomaly detection model, we use the Project Columns and PCA-based anomaly detection modules in a similar way.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, we first extract three variables - engine temperature, outside temperature, and speed - using the **Project Columns** module.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, we first extract three variables - engine temperature, outside temperature, and speed - using the **Project Columns** module.

trans-unit.source: We also include the speed variable since the engine temperature typically is correlated to the speed.
trans-unit.target: We also include the speed variable since the engine temperature typically is correlated to the speed.

trans-unit.source: Next we use PCA-based anomaly detection module to project the data from the 3-dimensional space onto a 2-dimensional space.
trans-unit.target: Next we use PCA-based anomaly detection module to project the data from the 3-dimensional space onto a 2-dimensional space.

trans-unit.source: The recall criteria are satisfied and so the vehicle requires recall when engine temperature and outside temperature are highly negatively correlated.
trans-unit.target: The recall criteria are satisfied and so the vehicle requires recall when engine temperature and outside temperature are highly negatively correlated.

trans-unit.source: Using PCA-based anomaly detection algorithm, we can capture the anomalies after performing PCA.
trans-unit.target: Using PCA-based anomaly detection algorithm, we can capture the anomalies after performing PCA.

trans-unit.source: Note that when training either model, we need to use normal data which does not require maintenance or recall as the input data to train the PCA-based anomaly detection model.
trans-unit.target: Note that when training either model, we need to use normal data which does not require maintenance or recall as the input data to train the PCA-based anomaly detection model.

trans-unit.source: In the scoring experiment, we use the trained anomaly detection model to detect if the vehicle requires maintenance or recall.
trans-unit.target: In the scoring experiment, we use the trained anomaly detection model to detect if the vehicle requires maintenance or recall.

trans-unit.source: Real-time analysis
trans-unit.target: Real-time analysis

trans-unit.source: The following Stream Analytics SQL Query is used to get the average of all the important vehicle parameters like vehicle speed, fuel level, engine temperature, odometer reading, tire pressure, engine oil level etc to detect anomalies, issue alerts and determine the overall health conditions of vehicles operated in specific region and correlate it to demographics.
trans-unit.target: The following Stream Analytics SQL Query is used to get the average of all the important vehicle parameters like vehicle speed, fuel level, engine temperature, odometer reading, tire pressure, engine oil level etc to detect anomalies, issue alerts and determine the overall health conditions of vehicles operated in specific region and correlate it to demographics.

trans-unit.source: Figure 15 – Stream analytics query for real-time processing
trans-unit.target: Figure 15 – Stream analytics query for real-time processing

trans-unit.source: All the averages are calculated over a 3 seconds TumblingWindow.
trans-unit.target: All the averages are calculated over a 3 seconds TumblingWindow.

trans-unit.source: We are using TubmlingWindow in this case since we require non-overlapping and contiguous time intervals.
trans-unit.target: We are using TubmlingWindow in this case since we require non-overlapping and contiguous time intervals.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about all the ‘Windowing’ capabilities in Azure Stream Analytics, click [Windowing (Azure Stream Analytics)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn835019.aspx).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about all the ‘Windowing’ capabilities in Azure Stream Analytics, click [Windowing (Azure Stream Analytics)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn835019.aspx).

trans-unit.source: **Real-time prediction**
trans-unit.target: **Real-time prediction**

trans-unit.source: An application is included as part of the solution to operationalize the machine learning model in real-time.
trans-unit.target: An application is included as part of the solution to operationalize the machine learning model in real-time.

trans-unit.source: This application called “RealTimeDashboardApp” is created and configured as part of the solution deployment.
trans-unit.target: This application called “RealTimeDashboardApp” is created and configured as part of the solution deployment.

trans-unit.source: The application performs the following:
trans-unit.target: The application performs the following:

trans-unit.source: Listens to an Event Hub instance where Stream Analytics is publishing the events in a continuously pattern.
trans-unit.target: Listens to an Event Hub instance where Stream Analytics is publishing the events in a continuously pattern.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig16-vehicle-telematics-stream-analytics-query-for-publishing.png)*Figure 16 – Stream analytics query for publishing the data to an output Event Hub instance*
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig16-vehicle-telematics-stream-analytics-query-for-publishing.png)*Figure 16 – Stream analytics query for publishing the data to an output Event Hub instance*

trans-unit.source: For every event that this application receives:
trans-unit.target: For every event that this application receives:

trans-unit.source: Processes the data using Machine Learning Request-Response Scoring (RRS) endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Processes the data using Machine Learning Request-Response Scoring (RRS) endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The RRS endpoint is automatically published as part of the deployment.
trans-unit.target: The RRS endpoint is automatically published as part of the deployment.

trans-unit.source: The RRS output is published to a PowerBI dataset using the push APIs.
trans-unit.target: The RRS output is published to a PowerBI dataset using the push APIs.

trans-unit.source: This pattern is also applicable in scenarios where you want to integrate a Line of Business application with the real-time analytics flow for scenarios such as alerts, notifications, messagings, etc.
trans-unit.target: This pattern is also applicable in scenarios where you want to integrate a Line of Business application with the real-time analytics flow for scenarios such as alerts, notifications, messagings, etc.

trans-unit.source: Click [RealtimeDashboardApp download](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717078) to download the RealtimeDashboardApp Visual Studio solution for customizations.
trans-unit.target: Click [RealtimeDashboardApp download](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=717078) to download the RealtimeDashboardApp Visual Studio solution for customizations.

trans-unit.target: **To execute the Real-time Dashboard Application **

trans-unit.target: Click on the PowerBI node on the diagram view and click the Download Real-time Dashboard Application’ link on the properties pane.

trans-unit.source: Batch analysis
trans-unit.target: Batch analysis

trans-unit.source: The goal here is to showcase how Contoso Motors is utilizing the Azure compute capabilities to harness big data to gain rich insights on driving pattern, usage behavior and vehicle health for:
trans-unit.target: The goal here is to showcase how Contoso Motors is utilizing the Azure compute capabilities to harness big data to gain rich insights on driving pattern, usage behavior and vehicle health for:

trans-unit.source: Improving the customer experience and make it cheaper by providing insights on driving habits and fuel efficient driving behaviors
trans-unit.target: Improving the customer experience and make it cheaper by providing insights on driving habits and fuel efficient driving behaviors

trans-unit.source: Learning proactively about customers and their driving patters to govern business decisions and provide the best in class products & services
trans-unit.target: Learning proactively about customers and their driving patters to govern business decisions and provide the best in class products & services

trans-unit.source: In this solution, we are targeting the following metrics:
trans-unit.target: In this solution, we are targeting the following metrics:

trans-unit.source: **Aggressive driving behavior** Identifies the trend of the models, locations, driving conditions, and time of the year to gain insights on aggressive driving pattern allowing Contoso Motors to use it for marketing campaigns, driving new personalized features and usage based insurance.
trans-unit.target: **Aggressive driving behavior** Identifies the trend of the models, locations, driving conditions, and time of the year to gain insights on aggressive driving pattern allowing Contoso Motors to use it for marketing campaigns, driving new personalized features and usage based insurance.

trans-unit.source: **Fuel efficient driving behavior** Identifies the trend of the models, locations, driving conditions, and time of the year to gain insights on fuel efficient driving pattern allowing Contoso Motors to use it for marketing campaigns, driving new features and proactive reporting to the drivers for cost effective and environment friendly driving habits.
trans-unit.target: **Fuel efficient driving behavior** Identifies the trend of the models, locations, driving conditions, and time of the year to gain insights on fuel efficient driving pattern allowing Contoso Motors to use it for marketing campaigns, driving new features and proactive reporting to the drivers for cost effective and environment friendly driving habits.

trans-unit.source: **Recall models** Identifies models requiring recalls by operationalizing the anomaly detection machine learning experiment
trans-unit.target: **Recall models** Identifies models requiring recalls by operationalizing the anomaly detection machine learning experiment

trans-unit.source: Let’s look into the details of each of these metrics,
trans-unit.target: Let’s look into the details of each of these metrics,

trans-unit.source: **Aggressive driving pattern**
trans-unit.target: **Aggressive driving pattern**

trans-unit.source: The partitioned vehicle signals and diagnostic data are processed in the pipeline named ‘AggresiveDrivingPatternPipeline’ using Hive to determine the models, location, vehicle and driving conditions etc that exhibits aggressive driving pattern.
trans-unit.target: The partitioned vehicle signals and diagnostic data are processed in the pipeline named ‘AggresiveDrivingPatternPipeline’ using Hive to determine the models, location, vehicle and driving conditions etc that exhibits aggressive driving pattern.

trans-unit.source: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig20-vehicle-telematics-aggressive-driving-pattern.png) *Figure 20 – Aggressive driving pattern workflow*
trans-unit.target: ![](./media/cortana-analytics-playbook-vehicle-telemetry-deep-dive/fig20-vehicle-telematics-aggressive-driving-pattern.png) *Figure 20 – Aggressive driving pattern workflow*

trans-unit.source: The Hive script named ‘aggresivedriving.hql’ used for analyzing aggressive driving condition pattern is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script named ‘aggresivedriving.hql’ used for analyzing aggressive driving condition pattern is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 21 – Aggressive driving pattern Hive query*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 21 – Aggressive driving pattern Hive query*

trans-unit.source: It uses the combination of vehicle’s transmission gear position, brake pedal status and speed to detect reckless/aggressive driving behavior based on braking pattern at high speed.
trans-unit.target: It uses the combination of vehicle’s transmission gear position, brake pedal status and speed to detect reckless/aggressive driving behavior based on braking pattern at high speed.

trans-unit.source: Once the pipeline is executed successfully, you will see the following partitions generated in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container.
trans-unit.target: Once the pipeline is executed successfully, you will see the following partitions generated in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 22 – AggressiveDrivingPatternPipeline output*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 22 – AggressiveDrivingPatternPipeline output*

trans-unit.source: **Fuel efficient driving pattern**
trans-unit.target: **Fuel efficient driving pattern**

trans-unit.source: The partitioned vehicle signals and diagnostic data are processed in the pipeline named ‘FuelEfficientDrivingPatternPipeline’ using Hive to determine the models, location, vehicle and driving conditions etc that exhibits fuel efficient driving pattern.
trans-unit.target: The partitioned vehicle signals and diagnostic data are processed in the pipeline named ‘FuelEfficientDrivingPatternPipeline’ using Hive to determine the models, location, vehicle and driving conditions etc that exhibits fuel efficient driving pattern.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 23 – Fuel efficient driving pattern workflow*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 23 – Fuel efficient driving pattern workflow*

trans-unit.source: The Hive script named ‘fuelefficientdriving.hql’ used for analyzing aggressive driving condition pattern is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.
trans-unit.target: The Hive script named ‘fuelefficientdriving.hql’ used for analyzing aggressive driving condition pattern is located at ‘\demo\src\connectedcar\scripts’ folder of the downloaded zip.

trans-unit.source: *Figure 24 – Fuel efficient driving pattern Hive query*
trans-unit.target: *Figure 24 – Fuel efficient driving pattern Hive query*

trans-unit.source: It uses the combination of vehicle’s transmission gear position, brake pedal status, speed and accelerator pedal position to detect fuel efficient driving behavior based on acceleration, braking and speed patterns.
trans-unit.target: It uses the combination of vehicle’s transmission gear position, brake pedal status, speed and accelerator pedal position to detect fuel efficient driving behavior based on acceleration, braking and speed patterns.

trans-unit.source: Once the pipeline is executed successfully, you will see the following partitions generated in your storage account under the ‘connectedcar’ container.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This document contains a detailed drill-down of the Vehicle Telemetry Analytics Solution.
trans-unit.target: This document contains a detailed drill-down of the Vehicle Telemetry Analytics Solution.

trans-unit.source: This showcases a lambda architecture pattern for real-time and batch analytics with predictions and actions.
trans-unit.target: This showcases a lambda architecture pattern for real-time and batch analytics with predictions and actions.

trans-unit.source: This pattern applies to a wide range of use cases that require hot path (real-time) and cold path (batch) analytics.
trans-unit.target: This pattern applies to a wide range of use cases that require hot path (real-time) and cold path (batch) analytics.
